results.title: COVID-19 in Children With Kidney Disease: A Report of 2 Cases
results.text_hl: He received bowel rest, intravenous (IV) fluids, and @CHEMICAL_Lansoprazole @CHEMICAL_MESH:D064747 @@@lansoprazole@@@. @<m>DISEASE_Vomiting</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D014839 @@@Emesis@@@ improved after 2 days.

results.title: Serotonin 5-HT3 Receptor-Mediated Vomiting Occurs via the Activation of Ca2+/CaMKII-Dependent ERK1/2 Signaling in the Least Shrew (Cryptotis parva)
results.text_hl: Pretreatment with the L-type Ca2+ channel blocker @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ (0, 1, 5, or 10 mg/kg, s.c.) dose-dependently suppressed both the @<m>DISEASE_Vomiting</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D014839 @@@vomit@@@ frequency (KW (3, 23) = 14.77, P<0.01) (Figure 1B, left panel) and the percentage of shrews @<m>DISEASE_Vomiting</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D014839 @@@vomiting@@@ (chi2 (3, 23) = 11.98; P<0.01) in response to 2-Me-5-HT (Figure 1B, right panel).

citations.NLM: Zhong W, Hutchinson TE, Chebolu S, Darmani NA. Serotonin 5-HT3 Receptor-Mediated Vomiting Occurs via the Activation of Ca2+/CaMKII-Dependent ERK1/2 Signaling in the Least Shrew (Cryptotis parva) PLoS One. 2014;9(8):e104718. PMID: 25121483

results.title: Broad-spectrum antiemetic efficacy of the L-type calcium channel blocker amlodipine in the least shrew (Cryptotis parva).
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@Amlodipine@@@ by itself suppressed the frequency of acute @CHEMICAL_Cisplatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002945 @@@cisplatin@@@ (10mg/kg, i.p)-induced @<m>DISEASE_Vomiting</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D014839 @@@vomiting@@@ in a dose-dependent manner.

results.title: Life-threatening calcium channel blocker overdose and its management.
results.text_hl: A young @SPECIES_9606 @@@woman@@@ presented to the emergency department with complaints of @DISEASE_Nausea @DISEASE_MESH:D009325 @@@nausea@@@, @<m>DISEASE_Vomiting</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D014839 @@@vomiting@@@, @DISEASE_Abdomen_Acute @DISEASE_MESH:D000006 @@@pain in the abdomen@@@ and @DISEASE_Dyspnea @DISEASE_MESH:D004417 @@@difficulty in breathing@@@ after ingestion of 56 tablets of @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ 5 mg each (total 280 mg of @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@).

citations.NLM: Rizvi I, Ahmad A, Gupta A, Zaman S. Life-threatening calcium channel blocker overdose and its management. BMJ Case Rep. 2012 May 30;2012():. PMID: 22669854
citations.BibTeX: @article{22669854, title={Life-threatening calcium channel blocker overdose and its management.}, author={Rizvi I and Ahmad A and Gupta A and Zaman S}, journal={BMJ Case Rep}, volume={2012}}

results.title: L-type calcium channels contribute to 5-HT3-receptor-evoked CaMKIIalpha and ERK activation and induction of emesis in the least shrew (Cryptotis parva).
results.text_hl: Activation of serotonergic 5-HT3 receptors by its selective agonist @CHEMICAL_2_methyl_5_HT @CHEMICAL_MESH:C045918 @@@2-methyl serotonin@@@ (2-Me-5-HT) induces @<m>DISEASE_Vomiting</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D014839 @@@vomiting@@@, which is sensitive to selective antagonists of both 5-HT3 receptors (@CHEMICAL_Palonosetron @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077924 @@@palonosetron@@@) and L-type calcium channels (LTCC) (@<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ or @CHEMICAL_Nifedipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D009543 @@@nifedipine@@@).

citations.NLM: Hutchinson TE, Zhong W, Chebolu S, Wilson SM, Darmani NA. L-type calcium channels contribute to 5-HT3-receptor-evoked CaMKIIalpha and ERK activation and induction of emesis in the least shrew (Cryptotis parva). Eur J Pharmacol. 2015 May 15;755():110-8. PMID: 25748600
citations.BibTeX: @article{25748600, title={L-type calcium channels contribute to 5-HT3-receptor-evoked CaMKIIalpha and ERK activation and induction of emesis in the least shrew (Cryptotis parva).}, author={Hutchinson TE and Zhong W and Chebolu S and Wilson SM and Darmani NA}, journal={Eur J Pharmacol}, volume={755}, pages={110-8}}
